A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: A triumph for Rian Johnson and despite the vitriol from misguided fans\, I have no doubt that this one will really stand the test of time. It is visually audacious and filled with wonderful idiosyncrasies but the great thing here is how Johnson smartly ignores much of the \"Mystery Box\" structure of The Force Awakens (even finding a convincing way to resolve that film's impossible cliffhanger) in favor of more self-reflective themes.
